meanings.definition: To spend time making minor adjustments to one's appearance, typically in front of a mirror.
meanings.sent1: She was primping in front of the mirror before the party.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, she enjoys primping her hair before heading out.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't stop primping, even when his friends teased him about it.
meanings.sent4: The model was primping herself like a masterpiece before the fashion show.
meanings.sent5: The bride was primping her veil to perfection for her special day.

meanings.definition: The act of grooming oneself carefully and attentively.
meanings.sent1: Her primping before the event made her look elegant.
meanings.sent2: His daily primping routine includes skincare and hair styling.
meanings.sent3: The cat's primping session after dinner was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The actor's primping backstage transformed him into a different character.
meanings.sent5: The dog's primping after a bath made its fur shine beautifully.
